content.new:
Running the 2018 dock example: `roslaunch vrx_gazebo dock.launch verbose:=true`

The `vrx_gazebo/worlds/dock.world.xacro` specifies red\_circle for bay1 and red\_cross for bay2, but the dock shows up with blue\_circle on both placards.

* The world uses the static dock\_2018 model. Changing the <color> and <shape> tags in the model.sdf.erb file can set the initial symbol values.
* The shuffling functionality seems to work `rostopic pub /vrx/dock_2018_placard1/shuffle std_msgs/Empty "{}"`
* Tried going back to [this commit](#!/osrf/vrx/commits/a29694cd3be48c771e59fbc5c30b9db8bd2a2e12) before reflections/refractions and recent dock tweaks, same behavior.
* In the dock\_2018/model.sdf.erb file, I set the PlacardPlugin <shuffle> tag to false.    Same behavior.

My understanding was that the ScanDockScoringPlugin::DockChecker objects should publish to the PlacardPlugin objects via Gazebo transport to be able to set the symbol \(color\+shape\) to be consistent with the <symbol> tags in the <bay> elements - true?

‌
content.old:
Running the 2018 dock example: `roslaunch vrx_gazebo dock.launch verbose:=true`

The `vrx_gazebo/worlds/dock.world.xacro`  specifies red\_circle for bay1 and red\_cross for bay2, but the dock shows up with blue\_circle on both placards.

* The world uses the static dock\_2018 model.  Changing the <color> and <shape> tags in the model.sdf.erb file can set the initial symbol values.
* The shuffling functionality seems to work `rostopic pub /vrx/dock_2018_placard1/shuffle std_msgs/Empty "{}"`

My understanding was that the ScanDockScoringPlugin::DockChecker objects should publish to the PlacardPlugin objects via Gazebo transport to be able to set the symbol \(color\+shape\) to be consistent with the <symbol> tags in the <bay> elements - true?

‌
